TEXT.English: While still young in giant years, she is the most pure-blooded descendant alive of the first female of the giant race, and is both wise and skilled. Enningas is highly priced by her people.[PARAGRAPH]"We are one people, from the time of the first mother and the first father, it is time to honor that!"
TEXT.French: While still young in giant years, she is the most pure-blooded descendant alive of the first female of the giant race, and is both wise and skilled. Enningas is highly priced by her people.[PARAGRAPH]"We are one people, from the time of the first mother and the first father, it is time to honor that!"
TEXT.German: Sie ist die reinblütigste, lebende Nachkommin der ersten Riesin und, obwohl sie noch jung an Riesenjahren ist, gilt sie doch sowohl als weise und fähig. Enningas wird von ihrem Volk hoch geschätzt.[PARAGRAPH]"Wir sind ein Volk, seit der Zeit unseres ersten Vaters und unserer ersten Mutter, es ist Zeit, das zu ehren!"
TEXT.Italian: While still young in giant years, she is the most pure-blooded descendant alive of the first female of the giant race, and is both wise and skilled. Enningas is highly priced by her people.[PARAGRAPH]"We are one people, from the time of the first mother and the first father, it is time to honor that!"
TEXT.Spanish: While still young in giant years, she is the most pure-blooded descendant alive of the first female of the giant race, and is both wise and skilled. Enningas is highly priced by her people.[PARAGRAPH]"We are one people, from the time of the first mother and the first father, it is time to honor that!"

TEXT.English: Old and stern, the aged Jotnar Kasghenal rules his people with a strong hand truthful with the traditions. He sees the giant-kin as above the other races, and as the Jotnar dwindle in birth he sees conquest and subjugation of nearby people as the only viable way for his people.[PARAGRAPH]"Let the little ones live in whatever way they choose, as long as they obey and sheds their blood for us. One of our kind can kill many of their before he falls, yet that way we shall still loose for they are as many as the stars and we are but a few."
TEXT.French: Old and stern, the aged Jotnar Kasghenal rules his people with a strong hand truthful with the traditions. He sees the giant-kin as above the other races, and as the Jotnar dwindle in birth he sees conquest and subjugation of nearby people as the only viable way for his people.[PARAGRAPH]"Let the little ones live in whatever way they choose, as long as they obey and sheds their blood for us. One of our kind can kill many of their before he falls, yet that way we shall still loose for they are as many as the stars and we are but a few."
TEXT.German: Der betagte Riese Kasghenal, alt und stur wie er ist, regiert sein Volk mit starker Hand mit viel Wert auf die Einhaltung der alten Traditionen. Für ihn stehen die Riesen über all den anderen Rassen, und da die Jotnar ein Nachwuchsproblem haben, sieht er Eroberung und Unterwerfung der benachbarten Völker als den einzigen Weg für sein Volk. [PARAGRAPH]"Laßt die kleinen Leute leben, wie sie wollen, so lange sie uns gehorchen und ihr Blut für uns vergießen. Einer von uns kann viele von ihnen töten, bevor er fällt, und dennoch werden wir auf diese Art verlieren, denn sie sind den Sternen an Zahl gleich, und wir doch nur so wenige."
TEXT.Italian: Old and stern, the aged Jotnar Kasghenal rules his people with a strong hand truthful with the traditions. He sees the giant-kin as above the other races, and as the Jotnar dwindle in birth he sees conquest and subjugation of nearby people as the only viable way for his people.[PARAGRAPH]"Let the little ones live in whatever way they choose, as long as they obey and sheds their blood for us. One of our kind can kill many of their before he falls, yet that way we shall still loose for they are as many as the stars and we are but a few."
TEXT.Spanish: Old and stern, the aged Jotnar Kasghenal rules his people with a strong hand truthful with the traditions. He sees the giant-kin as above the other races, and as the Jotnar dwindle in birth he sees conquest and subjugation of nearby people as the only viable way for his people.[PARAGRAPH]"Let the little ones live in whatever way they choose, as long as they obey and sheds their blood for us. One of our kind can kill many of their before he falls, yet that way we shall still loose for they are as many as the stars and we are but a few."

TEXT.English: It is rumored that Uxol's father was a Jotnar Vala and his mother a Troll Shamaness, and his birth was an strange union that came from making a deal over arcane power. In any case Uxol do possess powerful magical powers and press a policy of making allies with both wild tribes and strange monsters. In his reign the Vala's are raised highly and dominate the Jotnar society. [PARAGRAPH]"There is both wisdom and power to be found in the darkness."
TEXT.French: It is rumored that Uxol's father was a Jotnar Vala and his mother a Troll Shamaness, and his birth was an strange union that came from making a deal over arcane power. In any case Uxol do possess powerful magical powers and press a policy of making allies with both wild tribes and strange monsters. In his reign the Vala's are raised highly and dominate the Jotnar society. [PARAGRAPH]"There is both wisdom and power to be found in the darkness."
TEXT.German: Man erzählt sich, daß Uxols Vater ein Jotnar Vala und seine Mutter eine Troll Schamanin waren. Seine Geburt war das Ergebnis einer Vereinigung dieser beiden zur Besiegelung eines Abkommens über Zauberkraft. Wie auch immer, auf jeden Fall besitzt Uxol in der Tat beeindruckende magische Kräfte und es gelingt ihm, sich mit sowohl wilden Stämmen als auch furchtbaren Monstern zu verbünden. Während seiner Herrschaft werden die Vala extrem bevorzugt und dominieren die Jotnar Gesellschaft. [PARAGRAPH]"Man findet in der Dunkelheit sowohl Weisheit als auch Macht!"
TEXT.Italian: It is rumored that Uxol's father was a Jotnar Vala and his mother a Troll Shamaness, and his birth was an strange union that came from making a deal over arcane power. In any case Uxol do possess powerful magical powers and press a policy of making allies with both wild tribes and strange monsters. In his reign the Vala's are raised highly and dominate the Jotnar society. [PARAGRAPH]"There is both wisdom and power to be found in the darkness."
TEXT.Spanish: It is rumored that Uxol's father was a Jotnar Vala and his mother a Troll Shamaness, and his birth was an strange union that came from making a deal over arcane power. In any case Uxol do possess powerful magical powers and press a policy of making allies with both wild tribes and strange monsters. In his reign the Vala's are raised highly and dominate the Jotnar society. [PARAGRAPH]"There is both wisdom and power to be found in the darkness."

TEXT.English: Jotnar are the giant kin, an assortment of races that is held together by a common ancestry and traditions. They live centred around small family groups called 'Steaddings' or 'Homestaeds', not seldom attracting some odd kin to their dwellings. Hill giants, Trolls, Fiery giants, Tritons of the sea .. even the mightiest of them - the Titans - might fall in under their banners once they unraveled the mystery of immortality. Tightly held together, slow to bear offspring and to come to action, their pure size make them a force to be considered.[NEWLINE]STRATEGY: Cities will only use the first grid around it, instaed of two. This greatly influence the placement of cities. They can also never grow bigger then size ten, so aim for many small cities. The Goverment Civic 'Traditions' aid in this by reducing the maintnance cost for number of cities, the giant-kin are however so set in their ways that they cannot change their goverment civic - costing you some flexibility. Jotnar units are not built, they are born (exceptions are workers, settlers, thrall militia and some naval units). A rare and slow breed you are dependant on the emergence of new Jotnar Children and Adults, the citizens can then be upgraded into most units you need. Even settlers. And Jotnar Citizens can work the fields and break new roads while waiting to put them in use. They also slowly gains experience, so their time as Citizens are not wasted. The Jotnar can build a unique wonder after discovery of Code of Laws and Masonry that is called the Wall of the Covenant, and which holds the Barbarians at bay. A very useful wonder on maps with large landmass and active/agressive barbarians. To make sure that your units are not wasted (since you cannot massproduce them like other civilizations) build House of the Ancestors early in all cities, it gives your units the Spirit Guide promotion which gives some experience back to your other units when a unit dies.[NEWLINE]RELIGION: Jotnar have a preference for Runes of Kilmorph, however they can function well with any other faith. Extra gold is however important, so make sure to aquire some extra commerse if you choose some religion aside from RoK. Be aware that you cannot spread religion until Priesthood where you get a UU called Mouth of the divine that can spread religion without being lost.[NEWLINE]WAR: While Jotnar often cannot produce a massive amount of units in a short time, often hindered by an average of 1 units each twenty turns even with an unlimited supply of gold, they -are- giants. Many of Jotnar units are a little stronger then their normal counterparts, they ignore terrain and can often cross even mountains that allow them to attack from unexpected directions. They also do not need bring siege-machines, because each giant in himself can tear down a wall or two. Even the Jotnar Workers can bombard cities. For the devious one, Jotnar have the Hill Giants, whom can be mass produced with Hidden Nationality, often making it hard for even other players to determine if they are your units or are the real thing. Beware of recon units however, since the Hill Giants are considered animal units and some recon units have a high bonus in combat, and can even subdue your giants in service of another.
TEXT.French: Jotnar are the giant kin, an assortment of races that is held together by a common ancestry and traditions. They live centred around small family groups called 'Steaddings' or 'Homestaeds', not seldom attracting some odd kin to their dwellings. Hill giants, Trolls, Fiery giants, Tritons of the sea .. even the mightiest of them - the Titans - might fall in under their banners once they unraveled the mystery of immortality. Tightly held together, slow to bear offspring and to come to action, their pure size make them a force to be considered.[NEWLINE]STRATEGY: Cities will only use the first grid around it, instaed of two. This greatly influence the placement of cities. They can also never grow bigger then size ten, so aim for many small cities. The Goverment Civic 'Traditions' aid in this by reducing the maintnance cost for number of cities, the giant-kin are however so set in their ways that they cannot change their goverment civic - costing you some flexibility. Jotnar units are not built, they are born (exceptions are workers, settlers, thrall militia and some naval units). A rare and slow breed you are dependant on the emergence of new Jotnar Children and Adults, the citizens can then be upgraded into most units you need. Even settlers. And Jotnar Citizens can work the fields and break new roads while waiting to put them in use. They also slowly gains experience, so their time as Citizens are not wasted. The Jotnar can build a unique wonder after discovery of Code of Laws and Masonry that is called the Wall of the Covenant, and which holds the Barbarians at bay. A very useful wonder on maps with large landmass and active/agressive barbarians. To make sure that your units are not wasted (since you cannot massproduce them like other civilizations) build House of the Ancestors early in all cities, it gives your units the Spirit Guide promotion which gives some experience back to your other units when a unit dies.[NEWLINE]RELIGION: Jotnar have a preference for Runes of Kilmorph, however they can function well with any other faith. Extra gold is however important, so make sure to aquire some extra commerse if you choose some religion aside from RoK. Be aware that you cannot spread religion until Priesthood where you get a UU called Mouth of the divine that can spread religion without being lost.[NEWLINE]WAR: While Jotnar often cannot produce a massive amount of units in a short time, often hindered by an average of 1 units each twenty turns even with an unlimited supply of gold, they -are- giants. Many of Jotnar units are a little stronger then their normal counterparts, they ignore terrain and can often cross even mountains that allow them to attack from unexpected directions. They also do not need bring siege-machines, because each giant in himself can tear down a wall or two. Even the Jotnar Workers can bombard cities. For the devious one, Jotnar have the Hill Giants, whom can be mass produced with Hidden Nationality, often making it hard for even other players to determine if they are your units or are the real thing. Beware of recon units however, since the Hill Giants are considered animal units and some recon units have a high bonus in combat, and can even subdue your giants in service of another.
TEXT.German: Jotnar sind Riesen, eine Ansammlung von Rassen, die durch gemeinsame Vorfahren und Traditionen zusammengehalten wird. Sie leben im Verbund vieler kleiner Familien, die man 'Staedding' oder 'Heimstatt nennt. Nicht selten ziehen diese Siedlungen auch andere merkwürdige Rassen an, Hügelriesen, Trolle, Feuerriesen, Tritonen aus dem Meer ... selbst die mächtigsten unter ihnen, die Titanen, können sich ihrem Banner anschließen, sobald sie das Rätsel der Unsterblichkeit gelöst haben. Sie sind eng verbandelt, vermehren sich langsam und kommen langsam in Fahrt, doch ihre bloße Körpergröße macht sie zu einer nicht zu unterschätzenden Macht.[NEWLINE]Städte nutzen nur den inneren Kreis, anstelle von Zweien. Das hat großen Einfluss auf die Positionierung der Städte, welche niemals größer als 10 werden können, also sollte man auf viele kleine Städte abzielen. Die Regierungsform 'Traditionen' hilft dabei, indem sie den Unterhalt für die vielen Städte reduziert. Die Riesen müssen auf die Vorteile von anderen Regierungsformen verzichten, da können sie diese dafür nicht ändern können. Jotnar Einheiten werden nicht errichtet, sie werden geboren. Eine Ausnahme stellen Arbeitet, Siedler Leibeigenen Miliz, einige Seeeinheiten und einige Einheiten anderer Rassen dar. Durch die seltenen Geburten ist man im Spiel von den Geburten neuer Jotnar Kindern abhängig, diese Einheiten Jotnar Bürger können dann zu fast allen benötigten Einheiten aufgewertet werden. Selbst Siedlern. Außerdem können die Jotnar Bürger auf den Feldern arbeiten und neue Straßen erreichten, Minen ausbauen etc, während sie auf höhere Aufgaben warten. Sie erhalten dabei Erfahrung (wenn auch wenig), ihre Zeit als Bürger ist also nicht verschwendet. Die Jotnar können nach der Entdeckung der Gesetzgebung und Steinmetzkunst ein einzigartiges Weltwunder bauen, den Wall der Vereinigung, welcher Barbaren fernhält. Ein sehr nützliches Wunder auf großen Karten mit riesiger Landmasse und angriffslustigen Barbaren. Um sicherzustellen, dass die eigenen Einheiten nicht umsonst gestorben sind (da man sie ja nicht in Massenproduktion herstellen kann), sollte man das Häuser der Vorfahren errichten, sie gibt allen ausgebildeten Einheiten die "Geistführer" Beförderung, die einiges an Erfahrung auf andere Einheiten überträgt, wenn die Einheit stirbt.[NEWLINE]RELIGION UND FINANZEN: Zusätzliches Geld ist auf jeden Fall sehr wichtig, also sollte man beachten, daß man sich um andere Einnahmequellen kümmert, wenn man nicht Runen von Kilmorph als Religion hat. Religion kann man nicht verbreiten, bis man das Sprachrohr der Götter (Einheit) bauen kann (mit Priestertum). Dafür löst sich die Einheit nicht auf, wenn sie den Glauben verkündet.[NEWLINE]KRIEG: Auch wenn die Jotnar selbst mit einen unerschöpflichen Goldvorrat keine großen Mengen an Einheiten in kurzer Zeit produzieren können, da sie von den Geburten abhängig sind, sollte man nicht vergessen, was sie sind: Riesen! Viele der Jotnar Einheiten sind ein wenig stärker als die entsprechenden Einheiten der anderen Zivilisationen, erhalten zwar aufgrund ihrer Größe keine Verteidigungsboni, können aber auch über die für die anderen unpassierbaren Gipfel marschieren, um aus unerwarteter Richtung anzugreifen. Auch praktisch ist, daß sie keine Belagerungswaffen mitbringen brauchen, da sie alle (selbst die Jotnar Arbeiter!) selbst die ein oder andere Mauer einreißen können, da über die angeborene Bombardierungsfähigkeit verfügen. Wer es ein wenig verschlagen mag, darf sich auf die Hügelriesen verlegen, das Pendant zum Axtkämpfer! Sie können zu Scharen ausgebildet werden, alle mit verborgener Nationalität, was es oft selbst anderen Spielern schwer macht, zu unterscheiden, ob es sich bei den Einheiten um deine oder echte Hügelriesenbarbaren handelt. Allerdings sollte man sich mit Hügelriesen vor Aufklärungseinheiten in Acht nehmen, da sie als Tiere angesehen werden und deshalb im Kampf gegen Späher, Jäger etc. einen enormen Nachtteil haben und fallen können wie die Fliegen.

TEXT.English: A Jotnar child is born, this rare event is celebrated for a whole month in the Staedding.
TEXT.French: A Jotnar child is born, this rare event is celebrated for a whole month in the Staedding.
TEXT.German: Ein kleines Jotnar Kind wurde geboren, das ganze Staedding jubelt über dieses seltene Ereignis.
TEXT.Italian: A Jotnar child is born, this rare event is celebrated for a whole month in the Staedding.
TEXT.Spanish: A Jotnar child is born, this rare event is celebrated for a whole month in the Staedding.

TEXT.English: Some Jotnar citizens leaves an overgrown Staedding for other settlements, leaving praise and tribute for their old Homestaed.
TEXT.French: Some Jotnar citizens leaves an overgrown Staedding for other settlements, leaving praise and tribute for their old Homestaed.
TEXT.German: Einige Jotnar Bürger verlassen ein überbevölkertes Staedding für andere Siedlungen, nicht ohne dem alten Lob und Ehre zu bezeugen.
TEXT.Italian: Some Jotnar citizens leaves an overgrown Staedding for other settlements, leaving praise and tribute for their old Homestaed.
TEXT.Spanish: Some Jotnar citizens leaves an overgrown Staedding for other settlements, leaving praise and tribute for their old Homestaed.

TEXT.English: "We build, we toil, with our kin and for our kin with love in our hearts." - Egrass the Founder
TEXT.French: "We build, we toil, with our kin and for our kin with love in our hearts." - Egrass the Founder
TEXT.German: "Wir bauen, wir schuften, mit unserer Art und für unsere Art mit Liebe im Herzen." - Egrass der Gründer
TEXT.Italian: "We build, we toil, with our kin and for our kin with love in our hearts." - Egrass the Founder
TEXT.Spanish: "We build, we toil, with our kin and for our kin with love in our hearts." - Egrass the Founder

TEXT.English: The cornerstones in the Jotnar society, they grow and can take many roles and shapes to form the Jotnar civilization.
TEXT.French: The cornerstones in the Jotnar society, they grow and can take many roles and shapes to form the Jotnar civilization.
TEXT.German: Sie werden allzu selten geboren, können weder gekauft noch gebaut werden. Und doch stellen sie die Eckpfeiler der Jotnar Gesellschaft dar und wachsen und können kämpfen, das Land bestellen oder erkunden, bis sie sich für ihre endgültige Bestimmung entscheiden.
TEXT.Italian: The cornerstones in the Jotnar society, they grow and can take many roles and shapes to form the Jotnar civilization.
TEXT.Spanish: The cornerstones in the Jotnar society, they grow and can take many roles and shapes to form the Jotnar civilization.

TEXT.English: These giants are clad in thick iron and wield massive blades - a formidable foe to anyone that dares attack the Jotnar.
TEXT.French: These giants are clad in thick iron and wield massive blades - a formidable foe to anyone that dares attack the Jotnar.
TEXT.German: Diese Riesen sind in dickes Eisen gekleidet und schwingen riesige Klingen - ein wunderbarer Geselle, um die zu begrüßen, die es wagen, die Jotnar anzugreifen.
TEXT.Italian: These giants are clad in thick iron and wield massive blades - a formidable foe to anyone that dares attack the Jotnar.
TEXT.Spanish: These giants are clad in thick iron and wield massive blades - a formidable foe to anyone that dares attack the Jotnar.

TEXT.English: With a temper as fiery as their flesh, the Jotnar with blood from fire-giants in their veins throws themselves head first into battle - flames setting the land ablaze.
TEXT.French: With a temper as fiery as their flesh, the Jotnar with blood from fire-giants in their veins throws themselves head first into battle - flames setting the land ablaze.
TEXT.German: Mit dem flammenden Temperament der Feuer-Riesen in ihrem Blut, werfen sich dies Jotnar kopfüber in die Schlacht und haben ihre eigene Beleuchtung dabei. Beeindruckende Kämpfer.
TEXT.Italian: With a temper as fiery as their flesh, the Jotnar with blood from fire-giants in their veins throws themselves head first into battle - flames setting the land ablaze.
TEXT.Spanish: With a temper as fiery as their flesh, the Jotnar with blood from fire-giants in their veins throws themselves head first into battle - flames setting the land ablaze.

TEXT.English: The giant kin of the oceans are called the Tritons and they keep the large monsters of the waves in the same way that others keep dogs and cats. Tamed sea serpents and tortoises are often used by the Jotnar, and this can result in them being blamed for attacks from such creatures - and not always without cause.
TEXT.French: The giant kin of the oceans are called the Tritons and they keep the large monsters of the waves in the same way that others keep dogs and cats. Tamed sea serpents and tortoises are often used by the Jotnar, and this can result in them being blamed for attacks from such creatures - and not always without cause.
TEXT.German: Die Riesen der Ozeane werden Tritons genannt und sie halten sich große Monster der Wellen, wie andere sich Hunde oder Katzen halten. Gezähmte Seeschlangen und Schildkröten werden von den Jotnar häufig gehalten, was allzu häufig dazu führt, daß Angriffe durch solche den Riesen angelastet werden - und allzu häufig nicht zu unrecht.
TEXT.Italian: The giant kin of the oceans are called the Tritons and they keep the large monsters of the waves in the same way that others keep dogs and cats. Tamed sea serpents and tortoises are often used by the Jotnar, and this can result in them being blamed for attacks from such creatures - and not always without cause.
TEXT.Spanish: The giant kin of the oceans are called the Tritons and they keep the large monsters of the waves in the same way that others keep dogs and cats. Tamed sea serpents and tortoises are often used by the Jotnar, and this can result in them being blamed for attacks from such creatures - and not always without cause.

TEXT.English: The giant kin of the oceans are called the Tritons and they keep the large monsters of the waves in the same way that others keep dogs and cats. Tamed sea serpents and tortoises are often used by the Jotnar, and this can result in them being blamed for attacks from such creatures - and not always without cause.
TEXT.French: The giant kin of the oceans are called the Tritons and they keep the large monsters of the waves in the same way that others keep dogs and cats. Tamed sea serpents and tortoises are often used by the Jotnar, and this can result in them being blamed for attacks from such creatures - and not always without cause.
TEXT.German: Die Riesen der Ozeane werden Tritons genannt und sie halten sich große Monster der Wellen, wie andere sich Hunde oder Katzen halten. Gezähmte Seeschlangen und Schildkröten werden von den Jotnar ganz normal gehalten, was allzu häufig dazu führt, daß Angriffe durch solche den Riesen angelastet werden - und allzu häufig nicht zu unrecht.
TEXT.Italian: The giant kin of the oceans are called the Tritons and they keep the large monsters of the waves in the same way that others keep dogs and cats. Tamed sea serpents and tortoises are often used by the Jotnar, and this can result in them being blamed for attacks from such creatures - and not always without cause.
TEXT.Spanish: The giant kin of the oceans are called the Tritons and they keep the large monsters of the waves in the same way that others keep dogs and cats. Tamed sea serpents and tortoises are often used by the Jotnar, and this can result in them being blamed for attacks from such creatures - and not always without cause.

TEXT.English: The giant kin of the sea, bloated and serene, fickle yet with bottomless wisdom.
TEXT.French: The giant kin of the sea, bloated and serene, fickle yet with bottomless wisdom.
TEXT.German: Als die Riesen der See ist ihr Blut etwas verwässert und abgekühlt und legen doch ab und zu Weisheit an den Tag, tiefer als die Meere der Welt.
TEXT.Italian: The giant kin of the sea, bloated and serene, fickle yet with bottomless wisdom.
TEXT.Spanish: The giant kin of the sea, bloated and serene, fickle yet with bottomless wisdom.

TEXT.English: The healers, teachers and soul of their people - the speakers are only chosen from the most prominent of Giants.
TEXT.French: The healers, teachers and soul of their people - the speakers are only chosen from the most prominent of Giants.
TEXT.German: Die Heiler, die Lehrer, die Seele und die Redner der Jotnar sind die Skalden. Sie sind magisch begabt und werden selten und nur aus den Kreisen der berühmtesten Riesen erwählt.
TEXT.Italian: The healers, teachers and soul of their people - the speakers are only chosen from the most prominent of Giants.
TEXT.Spanish: The healers, teachers and soul of their people - the speakers are only chosen from the most prominent of Giants.

TEXT.English: The outmost powerful and respected Speakers reach the title of High Speaker - often having great influence over the Jotnar nation.
TEXT.French: The outmost powerful and respected Speakers reach the title of High Speaker - often having great influence over the Jotnar nation.
TEXT.German: Die mit Abstand mächtigsten und geachtetsten Redner und Führer erreichen den Titel des Hohen Redners - und haben großen Einfluss auf die Geschicke des Jotnar Volkes.
TEXT.Italian: The outmost powerful and respected Speakers reach the title of High Speaker - often having great influence over the Jotnar nation.
TEXT.Spanish: The outmost powerful and respected Speakers reach the title of High Speaker - often having great influence over the Jotnar nation.

TEXT.English: Humans living amongst the giants might be called Thralls, and subserviant to their huge masters - but are treated with much respect and wisdom. So that many of them will shed blood, or die to protect their homestaed.
TEXT.French: Humans living amongst the giants might be called Thralls, and subserviant to their huge masters - but are treated with much respect and wisdom. So that many of them will shed blood, or die to protect their homestaed.
TEXT.German: Sie sind Menschen. Und Menschen, die unter Riesen wohnen, werden zwar Leibeigene genannt und müssen deshalb auch auf Gedeih und Verderb gehorchen, werden aber nichtsdestotrotz mit großem Respekt und Umsicht behandelt. Denn da unzählige Heerscharen von ihnen ihr Blut für die Verteidigung der Jotnar vergießen werden, wenn sie müssen, und sie so klein sind, daß sie (in Riesenmaßstäben) nichts zu essen benötigen, sind sie nicht zu verachten. Und sie wachsen schließlich immer wieder nach. Im Gegensatz zu den Jotnar Riesen.
TEXT.Italian: Humans living amongst the giants might be called Thralls, and subserviant to their huge masters - but are treated with much respect and wisdom. So that many of them will shed blood, or die to protect their homestaed.
TEXT.Spanish: Humans living amongst the giants might be called Thralls, and subserviant to their huge masters - but are treated with much respect and wisdom. So that many of them will shed blood, or die to protect their homestaed.

TEXT.English: Easily percived as gods by humans, some ruthless Jotnar gather humans into cults - taught to live and die for their masters.
TEXT.French: Easily percived as gods by humans, some ruthless Jotnar gather humans into cults - taught to live and die for their masters.
TEXT.German: Leicht werden Riesen von Menschen als Götter angesehen. Und einige ruchlose Jotnar nutzen das aus und versammeln diese kleinen Leute in Kulten, um für ihre Meister zu leben und zu sterben.
TEXT.Italian: Easily percived as gods by humans, some ruthless Jotnar gather humans into cults - taught to live and die for their masters.
TEXT.Spanish: Easily percived as gods by humans, some ruthless Jotnar gather humans into cults - taught to live and die for their masters.

TEXT.English: Unruly and crude, these giant kin that are only loosely tied to those that they fight for. Simple and savage, they still are drawn to and yields to the Jotnar - making valuable allies.
TEXT.French: Unruly and crude, these giant kin that are only loosely tied to those that they fight for. Simple and savage, they still are drawn to and yields to the Jotnar - making valuable allies.
TEXT.German: Diese Riesenart ist ungebändigt und rauh, weshalb sie sich nur lose an die binden, für die sie kämpfen. Sie sind zwar einfach und wild, aber die Jotnar stellen doch eine Anziehungskraft für sie dar - was sie zu verlässlichen und wertvollen Verbündeten macht.
TEXT.Italian: Unruly and crude, these giant kin that are only loosely tied to those that they fight for. Simple and savage, they still are drawn to and yields to the Jotnar - making valuable allies.
TEXT.Spanish: Unruly and crude, these giant kin that are only loosely tied to those that they fight for. Simple and savage, they still are drawn to and yields to the Jotnar - making valuable allies.

TEXT.English: Bound in traditions, and more kin to bend to their own ways then to any gods, the Jotnar do however fall under divine influence. They have chosen to find and appoint certain Jotnar whom finds the calling to be the mouths of the divine, and to speak for the gods.
TEXT.French: Bound in traditions, and more kin to bend to their own ways then to any gods, the Jotnar do however fall under divine influence. They have chosen to find and appoint certain Jotnar whom finds the calling to be the mouths of the divine, and to speak for the gods.
TEXT.German: Obwohl sie an Traditionen gebunden sind und mehr nach der Art, daß sie sich vor ihresgleichen als vor Göttern verneigen, gibt es doch Jotnar, die unter göttlichen Einfluß geraten. So fühlen sich einige der Jotnar auserwählt und werden zu den Sprachrohren der Götter.
TEXT.Italian: Bound in traditions, and more kin to bend to their own ways then to any gods, the Jotnar do however fall under divine influence. They have chosen to find and appoint certain Jotnar whom finds the calling to be the mouths of the divine, and to speak for the gods.
TEXT.Spanish: Bound in traditions, and more kin to bend to their own ways then to any gods, the Jotnar do however fall under divine influence. They have chosen to find and appoint certain Jotnar whom finds the calling to be the mouths of the divine, and to speak for the gods.

TEXT.English: Warfare by word of mouth, gold, and perhaps the occasional assassination. Reduces a city's population by one. The Councilor escapes the city in the confusion and returns to the Scion capital.
TEXT.French: Warfare by word of mouth, gold, and perhaps the occasional assassination. Reduces a city's population by one. The Councilor escapes the city in the confusion and returns to the Scion capital.
TEXT.German: Kriegsführung durch Gerüchte, Bestechung und vielleicht auch einigen einzelnen Meuchelungen. Erniedrigt die Bevölkerung einer Stadt um 1. Der Berater entkommt im Durcheinander der Stadt und kehrt zur Hauptstadt der Scionen zurück.
TEXT.Italian: Warfare by word of mouth, gold, and perhaps the occasional assassination. Reduces a city's population by one. The Councilor escapes the city in the confusion and returns to the Scion capital.
TEXT.Spanish: Warfare by word of mouth, gold, and perhaps the occasional assassination. Reduces a city's population by one. The Councilor escapes the city in the confusion and returns to the Scion capital.

TEXT.English: The Jotnar people take great pride in breaking in the land, to build roads and to shape the world.
TEXT.French: The Jotnar people take great pride in breaking in the land, to build roads and to shape the world.
TEXT.German: Die Jotnar sind stolz darauf, daß Land zu brechen, zu formen und Straßen zu bauen.
TEXT.Italian: The Jotnar people take great pride in breaking in the land, to build roads and to shape the world.
TEXT.Spanish: The Jotnar people take great pride in breaking in the land, to build roads and to shape the world.

TEXT.English: Criminals among the Jotnar are often set into forced labour, much like when a Jotnar would be captured by a enemy that holds slaves.
TEXT.French: Criminals among the Jotnar are often set into forced labour, much like when a Jotnar would be captured by a enemy that holds slaves.
TEXT.German: Verurteilte Kriminelle unter den Jotnar werden von den Opfern häufig als Strafe zu Arbeit gezwungen und leben in fruchbaren Verhälnissen, ebenso wie sich echte Sklaven fühlen dürften.
TEXT.Italian: Criminals among the Jotnar are often set into forced labour, much like when a Jotnar would be captured by a enemy that holds slaves.
TEXT.Spanish: Criminals among the Jotnar are often set into forced labour, much like when a Jotnar would be captured by a enemy that holds slaves.

TEXT.English: Some Jotnar feel the calling of the wild, and forges a firm bond with all that grows.
TEXT.French: Some Jotnar feel the calling of the wild, and forges a firm bond with all that grows.
TEXT.German: Einige Jotnar fühlen den Ruf der Wildnis und schmieden ein starkes Band zu allem, das wächst und lebt.
TEXT.Italian: Some Jotnar feel the calling of the wild, and forges a firm bond with all that grows.
TEXT.Spanish: Some Jotnar feel the calling of the wild, and forges a firm bond with all that grows.

TEXT.English: The oldest of trolls, having gained not only in size but also in cunning and wisdom.
TEXT.French: The oldest of trolls, having gained not only in size but also in cunning and wisdom.
TEXT.German: Die ältesten der Trolle haben nicht nur an Größe, sondern auch an Weisheit und Durchtriebenheit zugelegt.
TEXT.Italian: The oldest of trolls, having gained not only in size but also in cunning and wisdom.
TEXT.Spanish: The oldest of trolls, having gained not only in size but also in cunning and wisdom.

TEXT.English: Having found their place in Jotnar society, the Troll hunters often express a overdue zeal to prove that they are better then their wild cousins from whom the sprung.
TEXT.French: Having found their place in Jotnar society, the Troll hunters often express a overdue zeal to prove that they are better then their wild cousins from whom the sprung.
TEXT.German: Die Jäger der Trolle haben ihren Platz in der Jotnar Gesellschaft gefunden und zeigen oft mit sehr großen Eifer, dass sie besser und gefestigter als ihr wilden Verwandten.
TEXT.Italian: Having found their place in Jotnar society, the Troll hunters often express a overdue zeal to prove that they are better then their wild cousins from whom the sprung.
TEXT.Spanish: Having found their place in Jotnar society, the Troll hunters often express a overdue zeal to prove that they are better then their wild cousins from whom the sprung.

TEXT.English: "In Greek mythology, the Titans were greater even than the gods. They ruled their universe with absolute power. Well that football field out there, that's our universe. Let's rule it like titans." - Coach Boone, Remember the Titans
TEXT.French: "In Greek mythology, the Titans were greater even than the gods. They ruled their universe with absolute power. Well that football field out there, that's our universe. Let's rule it like titans." - Coach Boone, Remember the Titans
TEXT.German: "In der Mythologie sind die Titanen noch höher anzusehen als Götter selbst. Sie herrschen über das Universum und sehen es als ihren Spielplatz an. Jeder sollte sich vor Titanen in Acht nehmen." - Coach Boone, Erinnert euch der Titanen
TEXT.Italian: "In Greek mythology, the Titans were greater even than the gods. They ruled their universe with absolute power. Well that football field out there, that's our universe. Let's rule it like titans." - Coach Boone, Remember the Titans
TEXT.Spanish: "In Greek mythology, the Titans were greater even than the gods. They ruled their universe with absolute power. Well that football field out there, that's our universe. Let's rule it like titans." - Coach Boone, Remember the Titans

TEXT.English: "We build, we toil, with our kin and for our kin with love in our hearts." - Egrass the Founder
TEXT.French: "We build, we toil, with our kin and for our kin with love in our hearts." - Egrass the Founder
TEXT.German: Er ist ein Held, eine Legende unter den Riesen. Schon zu seinen Lebzeiten wurden unzählige Geschichten seiner Weisheit und seine Tapferkeit überliefert. Mit einer für Riesen beeindruckenden inneren Ruhe und Zielstrebigkeit hat er sich zum Ziel gesetzt, die Riesen zu einem Volk zusammenzuschweißen, das die Bezeichnung "Riesen" verdient. Wo immer ein starker Arm benötigt wird, ist Egrass plötzlich zur Stelle, sei es zu Verteidigung des Reiches gegen Feinde von außen oder von innen oder um die Jotnar daran zu erinnern, daß er einen Traum hat, den er sich nicht von undisziplinierten Wilden zerstören läßt. Er kann eine Überzeugungskraft entwickeln, die jeden Riesen an seine Pflicht erinnert und ist sich dafür auch nicht zu schade. Wehe dem Tag, an dem er fällt. "Solange Egrass durch die Berge und Wiesen unseres Landes streift, kann niemand uns von unserem Weg abbringen. Wenn er versagt, haben auch wir versagt!" bekommt jedes Kind mit in die Wiege gelegt.
TEXT.Italian: "We build, we toil, with our kin and for our kin with love in our hearts." - Egrass the Founder
TEXT.Spanish: "We build, we toil, with our kin and for our kin with love in our hearts." - Egrass the Founder

TEXT.English: These giants are seen as freaks by some, and often wild and cruel hermits, those among the Jotnar however are disciplined wildmen with a sence of belonging and purpose. It is hard however to rouse them into battle quickly, as they easily become custom to the Jotnars peaceful life and do not like change.
TEXT.French: These giants are seen as freaks by some, and often wild and cruel hermits, those among the Jotnar however are disciplined wildmen with a sence of belonging and purpose. It is hard however to rouse them into battle quickly, as they easily become custom to the Jotnars peaceful life and do not like change.
TEXT.German: Diese Riesen werden von einigen als Mißgeburten angesehen und leben häufig ungezähmt und einsam. Und doch sind sie disziplinierte Wilde mit einem Sinn für Eigentum und Anspruch. Es ist allerdings nicht einfach, sie zum kämpfen zu bewegen, da sie sich leicht an das friedliche Leben der Jotnar gewöhnen und Veränderungen nicht mögen.
TEXT.Italian: These giants are seen as freaks by some, and often wild and cruel hermits, those among the Jotnar however are disciplined wildmen with a sence of belonging and purpose. It is hard however to rouse them into battle quickly, as they easily become custom to the Jotnars peaceful life and do not like change.
TEXT.Spanish: These giants are seen as freaks by some, and often wild and cruel hermits, those among the Jotnar however are disciplined wildmen with a sence of belonging and purpose. It is hard however to rouse them into battle quickly, as they easily become custom to the Jotnars peaceful life and do not like change.

TEXT.English: Sadly driven to madness and savage ways, these pityful giant kin seldom lives to their full growth. Finding some closeness with the Jotnar they still serve, but fickly so - many a homestaed have been attacked by crazed trolls.
TEXT.French: Sadly driven to madness and savage ways, these pityful giant kin seldom lives to their full growth. Finding some closeness with the Jotnar they still serve, but fickly so - many a homestaed have been attacked by crazed trolls.
TEXT.German: Diese bemitleidenswerten Geschöpfe erreichen selten das Erwachsenenalter, da sie allzu leicht verrückt werden, sich zu unzivilisierten und grausamen Taten getrieben sehen und auch wenn einige dieser launischen Kreaturen sich den Jotnar anschließen, wurden doch viel zu viele Staeddings von eben diesen duchgedrehten Trollen attackiert. Am besten hat man immer ein Auge auf sie.
TEXT.Italian: Sadly driven to madness and savage ways, these pityful giant kin seldom lives to their full growth. Finding some closeness with the Jotnar they still serve, but fickly so - many a homestaed have been attacked by crazed trolls.
TEXT.Spanish: Sadly driven to madness and savage ways, these pityful giant kin seldom lives to their full growth. Finding some closeness with the Jotnar they still serve, but fickly so - many a homestaed have been attacked by crazed trolls.

TEXT.English: The way of the giant people, carried with them through oral traditions from the creation of the world. Or so is claimed.
TEXT.French: The way of the giant people, carried with them through oral traditions from the creation of the world. Or so is claimed.
TEXT.German: Der Weg der Riesen wurde von ihnen seit der Schöpfung als mündliche überlieferung mit ihnen herumgeschleppt. Da es so viele Traditionen gibt, kann nur jemand der so groß wie ein Riese ist, sie auch tragen, sagt man.
TEXT.Italian: The way of the giant people, carried with them through oral traditions from the creation of the world. Or so is claimed.
TEXT.Spanish: The way of the giant people, carried with them through oral traditions from the creation of the world. Or so is claimed.

TEXT.English: "We have come from the mother and father, we are all sisters and brothers. Our traditions guides us and shows us the way."
TEXT.French: "We have come from the mother and father, we are all sisters and brothers. Our traditions guides us and shows us the way."
TEXT.German: "Wir stammen von Mutter und Vater, wir sind alle Brüder und Schwestern. Unsere Traditionen führen uns auf unserem Weg."
TEXT.Italian: "We have come from the mother and father, we are all sisters and brothers. Our traditions guides us and shows us the way."
TEXT.Spanish: "We have come from the mother and father, we are all sisters and brothers. Our traditions guides us and shows us the way."

TEXT.English: The Jotnar Staedding is the center of every Homestaed, the heart from where the ruling family governs their city.
TEXT.French: The Jotnar Staedding is the center of every Homestaed, the heart from where the ruling family governs their city.
TEXT.German: Das Jotnar Staedding ist das Zentrum eines jeden Homestaed, von wo aus die regierende Familie die Stadt lenkt.
TEXT.Italian: The Jotnar Staedding is the center of every Homestaed, the heart from where the ruling family governs their city.
TEXT.Spanish: The Jotnar Staedding is the center of every Homestaed, the heart from where the ruling family governs their city.

TEXT.English: The Giants are bound together by blood more then other creatures, it is not uncommon for an giant to remember things in passing that other long dead giants done. In the House of Ancestors, the Speakers of the Jotnar teaches how to use and value that link.
TEXT.French: The Giants are bound together by blood more then other creatures, it is not uncommon for an giant to remember things in passing that other long dead giants done. In the House of Ancestors, the Speakers of the Jotnar teaches how to use and value that link.
TEXT.German: Die Riesen fühlen sich durch ihr gemeinsames Blut mehr als alle anderen Kreaturen verbunden, es ist nicht ungewöhnlich, daß sich Riesen an Dinge erinnern, die schon lang verstorbene Riesen getan haben. Im Haus der Vorfahren lernen sie von den Sprechern der Jotnar, wie sie diese Verbindung schätzen und nutzen können.
TEXT.Italian: The Giants are bound together by blood more then other creatures, it is not uncommon for an giant to remember things in passing that other long dead giants done. In the House of Ancestors, the Speakers of the Jotnar teaches how to use and value that link.
TEXT.Spanish: The Giants are bound together by blood more then other creatures, it is not uncommon for an giant to remember things in passing that other long dead giants done. In the House of Ancestors, the Speakers of the Jotnar teaches how to use and value that link.

TEXT.English: A few of the mighty giants of the sea, the Tritons can rouse the sea and make it claim back land - adding to the eternal blue waves.
TEXT.French: A few of the mighty giants of the sea, the Tritons can rouse the sea and make it claim back land - adding to the eternal blue waves.
TEXT.German: Einige wenige der mächtigen Seeriesen, der Tritons, können das Meer aufwühlen und es dazu bringen, Land zurückzufordern. Dann wird es wieder eins mit den ewigen blauen Wellen der tiefen Weite.
TEXT.Italian: A few of the mighty giants of the sea, the Tritons can rouse the sea and make it claim back land - adding to the eternal blue waves.
TEXT.Spanish: A few of the mighty giants of the sea, the Tritons can rouse the sea and make it claim back land - adding to the eternal blue waves.

TEXT.English: When a Triton unit reaches a certain age, the unit can by casting a spell - spend three turns on a sea/lake adjectant tile turn it into water terrain. Will cause war.
TEXT.French: When a Triton unit reaches a certain age, the unit can by casting a spell - spend three turns on a sea/lake adjectant tile turn it into water terrain. Will cause war.
TEXT.German: Wenn ein Triton ein gewisses Alter erreicht, kann die Einheit einen Zauber sprechen, der ein dem Meer oder See benachbartes Landfeld in Wasser verwandelt. Dauert drei Runden und verursacht Krieg.
TEXT.Italian: When a Triton unit reaches a certain age, the unit can by casting a spell - spend three turns on a sea/lake adjectant tile turn it into water terrain. Will cause war.
TEXT.Spanish: When a Triton unit reaches a certain age, the unit can by casting a spell - spend three turns on a sea/lake adjectant tile turn it into water terrain. Will cause war.

TEXT.English: Allows the Mouth of the divine to pass on the message of the gods.
TEXT.French: Allows the Mouth of the divine to pass on the message of the gods.
TEXT.German: Erlaubt dem Sprachrohr der Götter, die Botschaft der Götter zu verbreiten.
TEXT.Italian: Allows the Mouth of the divine to pass on the message of the gods.
TEXT.Spanish: Allows the Mouth of the divine to pass on the message of the gods.

TEXT.English: (Loose three population in all cities, 10% chance of a new Jotnar Adult in each city.)
TEXT.French: (Loose three population in all cities, 10% chance of a new Jotnar Adult in each city.)
TEXT.German: (verringert die Bevölkerung aller Städte um 3, 10% Chance auf einen neuen Jotnar Bürger in jeder Stadt.)
TEXT.Italian: (Loose three population in all cities, 10% chance of a new Jotnar Adult in each city.)
TEXT.Spanish: (Loose three population in all cities, 10% chance of a new Jotnar Adult in each city.)

TEXT.English: As the world starts to grow darker, and the judgement of the Gods start to fall upon the world - the Jotnar starts out in search for an answer - to find those children lost that where never had. Villages and cities grow deserted, and many loved ones never return. But amidst the sorrow there is joy, for never have there been so many Jotnar children born in one year. The old and wise claim that one of the one's whom left on the quest never to return found the answer, and will one day come back to save the Jotnar people.
TEXT.French: As the world starts to grow darker, and the judgement of the Gods start to fall upon the world - the Jotnar starts out in search for an answer - to find those children lost that where never had. Villages and cities grow deserted, and many loved ones never return. But amidst the sorrow there is joy, for never have there been so many Jotnar children born in one year. The old and wise claim that one of the one's whom left on the quest never to return found the answer, and will one day come back to save the Jotnar people.
TEXT.German: Wenn die Welt dunkler wird und die Richtersprüche der Götter über die Erde gesprochen werden, beginnen die Jotnar nach einer Antwort zu suchen, eine Antwort darauf, was mit all den verlorenen Kindern pasierte, die sie nie hatten. Sie suchen und suchen und Dörfer und Häuser werden durchsucht und verlassen und viele kehren von der Suche nie zurück. Und doch werden nie wieder so viele Kinder geboren werden, wie in diesem Jahr. Die Alten und Weisen behaupten, daß einer von denen, die auf der Suche verloren gegangen sind, eines Tages wiederkommen wird, um die Jotnar zu retten.
TEXT.Italian: As the world starts to grow darker, and the judgement of the Gods start to fall upon the world - the Jotnar starts out in search for an answer - to find those children lost that where never had. Villages and cities grow deserted, and many loved ones never return. But amidst the sorrow there is joy, for never have there been so many Jotnar children born in one year. The old and wise claim that one of the one's whom left on the quest never to return found the answer, and will one day come back to save the Jotnar people.
TEXT.Spanish: As the world starts to grow darker, and the judgement of the Gods start to fall upon the world - the Jotnar starts out in search for an answer - to find those children lost that where never had. Villages and cities grow deserted, and many loved ones never return. But amidst the sorrow there is joy, for never have there been so many Jotnar children born in one year. The old and wise claim that one of the one's whom left on the quest never to return found the answer, and will one day come back to save the Jotnar people.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Doubles the Experience points of all your Giantkin units
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Doubles the Experience points of all your Giantkin units
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Doubles the Experience points of all your Giantkin units
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Doubles the Experience points of all your Giantkin units

TEXT.English: As the light of the world dwindles, the Jotnar Children grow fewer and fewer - as a desperate measure the giant races intimidate and impress orcs into their service equipping them with weapons and armor and sending them into their deaths to spare the lives of their giant kin.
TEXT.French: As the light of the world dwindles, the Jotnar Children grow fewer and fewer - as a desperate measure the giant races intimidate and impress orcs into their service equipping them with weapons and armor and sending them into their deaths to spare the lives of their giant kin.
TEXT.German: Wie das Licht der Welt schwindet, werden die Jotnar immer weniger und weniger. Als eine verzweifelte Maßnahme überzeugen und rekrutieren sie Orks in ihre Dienste, rüsten sie mit Waffen und Rüstung aus und schicken sie an ihrer Stelle in den Kampf, um Leben der Riesen selbst zu schonen.
TEXT.Italian: As the light of the world dwindles, the Jotnar Children grow fewer and fewer - as a desperate measure the giant races intimidate and impress orcs into their service equipping them with weapons and armor and sending them into their deaths to spare the lives of their giant kin.
TEXT.Spanish: As the light of the world dwindles, the Jotnar Children grow fewer and fewer - as a desperate measure the giant races intimidate and impress orcs into their service equipping them with weapons and armor and sending them into their deaths to spare the lives of their giant kin.

TEXT.English: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]All armored units get fine armor promotion.
TEXT.French: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]All armored units get fine armor promotion.
TEXT.German: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]All armored units get fine armor promotion.
TEXT.Italian: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]All armored units get fine armor promotion.
TEXT.Spanish: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]All armored units get fine armor promotion.

TEXT.English: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]All armored units get elite armor promotion.
TEXT.French: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]All armored units get elite armor promotion.
TEXT.German: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]All armored units get elite armor promotion.
TEXT.Italian: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]All armored units get elite armor promotion.
TEXT.Spanish: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]All armored units get elite armor promotion.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Sacrifice a Thrall Militia to heal the Giant
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Sacrifice a Thrall Militia to heal the Giant
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]Sacrifice a Thrall Militia to heal the Giant
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Sacrifice a Thrall Militia to heal the Giant
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Sacrifice a Thrall Militia to heal the Giant
